metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to halsin after triggering any of the topical greeting conditions.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: Zevlor turned to darkness in his desperation... but he did not deserve a fate such as that.
0.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Referring to an old acquaintance who was found dead and mutilated

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: A shame that Minsc had to die. I sense he could have been an ally to us, had circumstances been different.

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: A cruel parting of ways with Shadowheart. I can only hope the allies we have won will be worth our betrayal.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: Astarion... he has ascended amongst the ranks of the undead. I can only hope that he does not come to regret the price that he paid.

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: This orb... Gale carries a most dire burden. I wish he had shared it with us sooner.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: Our work is not yet finished - not until Ketheric Thorm's last breath flees his corpse. Let us pursue him.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: Vampire spawn assailing us in the night? I thought we had ample troubles as it was. At least Astarion is safe.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: Orin has made off with Gale - we must rescue him... unless you wish to kill Gortash for her.

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: You did well to steer us from violence. But Lorroakan is too bloody-minded to be fooled for long.

24.speaker: Halsin
24.text: Let Dame Aylin know his ambitions - and put an end to them, so that she might finally live free.

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: Moonrise Towers. Many druids and Harpers died to take this place once... only for Ketheric Thorm to rule it once again.

20.speaker: Halsin
20.text: This place is not of the natural realm... it is the domain of darkness, emptiness, sheer nothingness.

21.speaker: Halsin
21.text: A temple dedicated to Shar. More than a temple perhaps - a proving ground. This must be where Ketheric Thorm grew his dark-cloaked ranks.

22.speaker: Halsin
22.text: The belly of the city. How many people are born, live, and die within these walls without ever seeing the depths of nature's beauty for themselves? I shudder to think.

23.speaker: Halsin
23.text: Lorroakan hunts powerful game - too powerful for him, perhaps. Dame Aylin should be informed that yet another ambitious fool lusts after her.

25.speaker: Halsin
25.text: There is something foul to to air here - it reeks of madness and death.

26.speaker: Halsin
26.text: Orin has taken Yenna. We must free her - either by force, or by paying for her freedom with Gortash's life.

28.speaker: Halsin
28.text: You have carried this burden for too long already - I simply do not believe that ceremorphosis is the only course left to you. Orpheus must help us.

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: Shar sought rob Shadowheart of her family - of her true nature. But no more. Now the  healing can begin.

30.speaker: Halsin
30.text: Gale defied Mystra herself. I hope he does not come to regret it.

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: Astarion resisted the allure of Cazador's would-be powers - and I am glad of it. Whatever he would have gained would have come at a great price.

32.speaker: Halsin
32.text: Jaheira's family is a credit to her - she is wise to keep them secret, safe.

36.speaker: Halsin
36.text: I was never afforded a chance to start a family of my own - serving nature always had to come first.

34.speaker: Halsin
34.text: Gale, you truly thought to turn to shadow magic, after seeing how it has ravaged nature? Your ambitions are... disquieting.

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: Karlach has had her mortality defined to her in most cruel terms... I do not know if we can help her, but perhaps we can at least be there for her.
38.context: NodeContext: Commenting on extensive ruins beneath a city

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: A city within a city, older as you go deeper. Much like the rings of a tree.
39.context: NodeContext: Commenting on extensive ruins beneath a city

40.speaker: Halsin
40.text: A hammer capable of shattering the bonds in the Astral Plane? That sounds like something we should seek out.

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: Those vampire spawn made off with Astarion. It shall fall to us to rescue him.

44.speaker: Halsin
44.text: Shar's ire has shaken Shadowheart... and yet she goes on. There is untold strength there, I feel.

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: I am unsure if Shadowheart would have remained committed to the darkness, if put to the test... but we did not afford her the chance to decide.

117.speaker: Halsin
117.text: A pity. I sensed a love of nature and animals in her. There may have been more to her than even she knew of.

46.speaker: Halsin
46.text: Astarion... he has ascended amongst the ranks of the undead. I can only hope that he does not come to regret the price that he paid.

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: Mystra has forsaken Gale entirely. A crushing blow... but he is strong enough to persevere, I think.

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: A cruel task fell to Shadowheart... but she did as her parents wished. She has my eternal respect, and I hope she soon finds peace.

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: It is no small thing, to defy a goddess. Perhaps the darkness is not Shadowheart's true nature.

51.speaker: Halsin
51.text: Nature cares little for nobility - it is pure artifice - but I can still hold some respect for Wyll's accomplishment. He shall be a fine Duke, I am sure.

52.speaker: Halsin
52.text: It seems that Wyll's determined to remain the Blade of Frontiers. I suppose he's truly earned the moniker, now.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: Lae'zel's faith in her queen is unshakeable, it seems. I just hope Vlaakith recognises that.
53.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reacting to Avatar Gale seemingly gaining a blessing for ressiting the urge to consume dark magic.

54.speaker: Halsin
54.text: Your self-discipline has been rewarded, I think. Perhaps Mystra is more invested in your survival than you might believe...
54.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reacting to Avatar Gale seemingly gaining a blessing for ressiting the urge to consume dark magic.

55.speaker: Halsin
55.text: Once, you would have to sway hearts in order to raise an army... but with this place? Any tyrant could lay claim to legions of artificial killers.

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: Karlach has had her mortality defined to her in most cruel terms... I do not know if we can help her, but perhaps we can at least be there for her.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: Minsc believes a doppelganger to be Jaheira? He is being manipulated - I am all but certain.

58.speaker: Halsin
58.text: Minsc has great heart - we shall need the likes of him, for the trials to come.

59.speaker: Halsin
59.text: I cannot imagine how you are feeling, Gale. For a goddess to ask a mortal to pay such a price. I am sorry for, for your burden... though I wish you had told us of your predicament before.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: Mizora dead... and Wyll, doomed to the Hells. Oak Father, lend him your strength.

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: We allowed Astarion to sacrifice so many, only to just turn on him soon after? We should have stopped him sooner.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: I cannot imagine how you are feeling, Gale. For a goddess to ask a mortal to pay such a price... I am sorry for, for your burden.

63.speaker: Halsin
63.text: This place is unnatural in ways I cannot truly fathom - a vile celebration of death without purpose.

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: That... creature you changed into. I pray to Silvanus that you have it under control.

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: Gortash's bluster will no longer assail our ears. And we have his Netherstone also - soon we shall unravel this unnatural conspiracy, once and for all.

69.speaker: Halsin
69.text: Wyll sacrificed a great deal for his family. The pact may stand, but the strength of his character is clear.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: Karlach's rage is like a force of nature. I pity those who bear its brunt.

71.speaker: Halsin
71.text: Vlaakith's words have set Lae'zel's mind, it seems. I would not wish to be the one that the Lich Queen unleashes her upon.

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: Jaheira's wisdom is plain to see. She understands that to truly serve nature, you must one day surrender your body back to it.

128.speaker: Halsin
128.text: Yet, she fears there are none to inherit her work, so she goes on. Long life can be a burden at times - I know that well.

73.speaker: Halsin
73.text: Mizora schemes with Wyll's very freedom. He deserves to know what she is up to.

74.speaker: Halsin
74.text: Jaheira's wisdom is plain to see. One of the greatest ways in which you can serve nature is to surrender your body back to it, when the time comes.

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: It may be some centuries before my flesh is ready to yield, but I hope I shall be bold enough to follow in her path, when the day comes.

75.speaker: Halsin
75.text: Mystra would ask for Gale's life in return for forgiveness...? A cruel demand to make of a mortal.

78.speaker: Halsin
78.text: Shadow magic, Gale...? No matter how desperate times become, you should not defile yourself with such foul matters. You are better than that.

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: I fought proudly alongside Harpers once... but it seems we cannot place our trust in them now - not while Orin has their ranks infiltrated.

80.speaker: Halsin
80.text: Wyll intends to take the fight to the very Hells themselves? I can think of no one more capable.

81.speaker: Halsin
81.text: Shadowheart truly is Shar's instrument now. At least perhaps her new dark-cloaked followers can help in the fight against the Absolute.

83.speaker: Halsin
83.text: A pact made with Raphael will surely bring nothing but misfortune, as much as I would like to be proven wrong.

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: I am sorry, Gale. You tried. Mystra was wrong to turn on you, no matter what mistakes you made in the past.

85.speaker: Halsin
85.text: Will Orin truly free Lae'zel if we slay Gortash? I am not so sure... a rescue may be in order.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: Alfira died badly. I can only hope the others that share this campfire do not share her fate...

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: It seems Gale has made amends with Mystra. I see this as a good omen for what awaits us.

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: I thought Lae'zel's faith in Vlaakith was unshakeable. Perhaps Voss shall prove to be a more worthy ally to her.

90.speaker: Halsin
90.text: It seems you have made amends with Mystra, Gale. Congratulations. I see this as a good omen for what awaits us.

91.speaker: Halsin
91.text: Of course Thorm would flee to such a repellent, unnatural place. Let us put an end to him and get out of here.
91.context: NodeContext: Hopeful/determined. His lifelong goal of cleansing a cursed land is nearly fulfilled

92.speaker: Halsin
92.text: I can already sense the first stirrings of new life in the land. The grip of the curse is weakening - now we must break it, once and for all.
92.context: NodeContext: Hopeful/determined. His lifelong goal of cleansing a cursed land is nearly fulfilled

93.speaker: Halsin
93.text: I had hoped you would shun Bhaal's overtures... but those hopes are dashed. To be a vessel for murder itself? I can think of few things less natural.

94.speaker: Halsin
94.text: For so long, we have fought the Absolute... only to now learn you were once one of its masterminds? There is nothing we can take for granted.

95.speaker: Halsin
95.text: The final battle is upon us. May the Oak Father grant us victory.

96.speaker: Halsin
96.text: Shadowheart's true nature won out in the end, no matter how much Shar tried to bury it. It gladdens my heart to see a family reunited.

98.speaker: Halsin
98.text: Poor Gale... but Mystra is wrong about him. Perhaps he can yet prove that.

100.speaker: Halsin
100.text: Wyll sacrificed his own father... a hard choice, but not one that is unknown in nature. At times, a seedling must strangle the very tree that bore it, if it is to survive.

101.speaker: Halsin
101.text: Astarion resisted the allure of Cazador's would-be powers - and I am glad of it. Whatever he would have gained would have come at a great price.

105.speaker: Halsin
105.text: Last Light fell because you could not control the violence in your heart. All those people perished because of what you did to Isobel. You must try harder. You must be better.

106.speaker: Halsin
106.text: Defying a goddess, Gale? And one you have known so intimately? I hope you do not come to regret this.

107.speaker: Halsin
107.text: A curious discovery, this place. This city builds and builds upon itself, until it forgets its own secrets.

108.speaker: Halsin
108.text: A lair of undeath - most unnatural. We must tread carefully.

110.speaker: Halsin
110.text: So, only a mind flayer can wield the stones, if you trust the Emperor's word.

76.speaker: Halsin
76.text: Karlach has offered to take up the mantle. I think you should let her have her wish. Her time is short, but she can live on in all the hearts of those she will have saved.

140.speaker: Halsin
140.text: But let us not forget that we also have the Orphic Hammer. We could free Orpheus, let him wield the stones - if we can trust him.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: It will be me. I'll become illithid. I'm not afraid.

88.speaker: Halsin
88.text: Not a decision you have made lightly, I trust. You have my support, no matter what.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I spoke to Karlach already - I agreed to let her transform. This is what she wants.

123.speaker: Halsin
123.text: So be it, then. We must do all we can to help her reach her destiny.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I don't want this for Karlach; I won't allow it.

97.speaker: Halsin
97.text: I see... then I hope she understands. You have steered us true, thus far.

116.speaker: Halsin
116.text: Now, the final decision rests with you. Whatever you choose, I shall be by your side.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: Fair. But a decision is still needed.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: None of us are about to turn into an illithid. I shall give the stones to the Emperor.

35.speaker: Halsin
35.text: I trust you to do what you think is best... but I just hope that we can indeed trust the Emperor in turn...

41.speaker: Player
41.text: We have the hammer - now is the time to use it. We'll release Orpheus.

82.speaker: Halsin
82.text: So be it. Whatever happens, I shall stand by you.

111.speaker: Halsin
111.text: This 'stone lord' and Minsc are one and the same? Jaheira's friend has taken a dark turn, it seems.

112.speaker: Halsin
112.text: All of nature's creatures need to consume something to sustain themselves... but Gale needs to absorb powerful magic...?

119.speaker: Halsin
119.text: How can such a predicament come to be, I wonder...?

65.speaker: Halsin
65.text: I can only hope he manages to find what he needs - for his sake and ours.

113.speaker: Halsin
113.text: Freeing Mizora... I can only hope that is a kindness we do not come to regret.

114.speaker: Halsin
114.text: The Netherbrain's lair. We may be near the end of all this...

115.speaker: Halsin
115.text: Shar's worshippers had ambitions beyond their strength, it seems. The Astral Prism - or its inhabitants - would never have yielded to them.

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: For that at least, I am thankful.

120.speaker: Halsin
120.text: An infernal abode. This is not a place in which we should linger too long.

122.speaker: Halsin
122.text: We had an item of great magic before - what came of it, Gale?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I need it. You see, I have rather dangerous malady that threatens myself - and others - if I do not sate it with magical items...

124.speaker: Halsin
124.text: The battle is not yet over - yet we still stand. Let us finish this.

125.speaker: Halsin
125.text: The depths are no place for me - I shall be glad to walk upon dry land once again.

126.speaker: Halsin
126.text: The Orphic Hammer is ours. Now to put it to use.

127.speaker: Halsin
127.text: I sincerely hope that acquiring that amulet was the lesser of two evils...

129.speaker: Halsin
129.text: I cannot believe Mystra would truly sacrifice a mind such as Gale's in order to stop the Absolute... he has so much potential...

130.speaker: Halsin
130.text: Hidden in the depths. The perfect place for nefarious secrets.

131.speaker: Halsin
131.text: Battle has been joined. We cannot let up until Ketheric Thorm is no more.

132.speaker: Halsin
132.text: So, it seems that Vlaakith is Lae'zel's queen no longer. That took no small amount of backbone.

133.speaker: Halsin
133.text: So, only a mind flayer can wield the stones, if you trust the Emperor's word.

99.speaker: Halsin
99.text: Let us not forget that we also have the Orphic Hammer. We could free Orpheus, let him wield the stones - if we can trust him.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

27.speaker: Halsin
27.text: Fair. But a decision is still needed.

134.speaker: Halsin
134.text: A foul place, that we have found ourselves in. But at least we survived the fall.

135.speaker: Halsin
135.text: There is no deal with a devil that I would willingly partake in. Declining Raphael showed great wisdom.

136.speaker: Halsin
136.text: Wyrm's Crossing - the gaping maw of the city. Nature has little control over what happens beyond that bridge.

137.speaker: Halsin
137.text: Remember - whatever evil is trying to control you, I know you are stronger. Resist.

138.speaker: Halsin
138.text: Painful truths have been thrust upon Shadowheart. I believe she is strong enough to endure, but her path will be easier with our support.

139.speaker: Halsin
139.text: Bears have perhaps the best sense of smell of all animals - a curse in a place such as this.

141.speaker: Halsin
141.text: Raphael is no more. I shall not shed any tears.

142.speaker: Halsin
142.text: The decision is made. I can only pray to the Oak Father that we choose wisely. Onwards.

143.speaker: Halsin
143.text: Bhaal has condemned you to madness... I can only hope it does not come to pass.

144.speaker: Halsin
144.text: A shapeshifter infiltrating our number, like a cuckoo creeping into the nest? A dire threat, if Gortash indeed spoke the truth.

145.speaker: Halsin
145.text: I am glad to have Gale back with us. The group would be poorer without his insights - and his company.

146.speaker: Halsin
146.text: I cannot believe Mystra would truly sacrifice a mind such as Gale's in order to stop the Absolute... he has so much potential...

147.speaker: Halsin
147.text: Even with the shadow curse gone, Shar's presence blooms everywhere. No doubt her teachings have found a strong purchase amongst the city's populace.

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: Astarion seems well - full of life, even. I hope that does not mean that someone else is lacking life.

149.speaker: Halsin
149.text: My heart grows heavy for Karlach. She can touch, once more... yet is her remaining time to truly be so short? I shall pray to Silvanus that it does not come to pass.

150.speaker: Halsin
150.text: An unfortunate battle... but I must stand by those I count as allies.

151.speaker: Halsin
151.text: I cannot believe that Gale kept such a secret from us... and now his goddess wishes him to make the ultimate sacrifice in her name...?

152.speaker: Halsin
152.text: The blight that was Orin has been purged from the world. And we have another Netherstone also - a significant step towards stopping this evil, once and for all.

153.speaker: Halsin
153.text: So your confidante was a mind flayer all along...? Disquietening, to say the least...

154.speaker: Halsin
154.text: One of us must take this step... and Karlach's time is already dwindling. Perhaps she is the champion we need.

155.speaker: Halsin
155.text: The moon weeps, for what Shadowheart has done. For her sake, I hope the approval of her goddess was worth it.

156.speaker: Halsin
156.text: You fought hard to win back control over yourself. I can only imagine how you feel - congratulations.

157.speaker: Halsin
157.text: That foul shapeshifter Orin is like a scavenger beast - probing us for weaknesses. Do not let her shake your resolve.

158.speaker: Halsin
158.text: I was concerned when I saw Shadowheart creeping about with a blade in the dead of night, but it was just to cut her hair, it seems. It suits her.
